170035-d-12-18-01-DH.Narrative: TRAIN 514-17 PULLED OUT OF WHITEHALL YARD AT THE SOUTHEND TO DEPART.  CONDUCTOR PULLED TRAIN SOUTWARD FAR ENOUGH TO CLEAR BOTH DERAIL AND CONTROLLED SIDING SWITCH.  CONDUCTOR RESTORED THE DERAIL AND LOCKED SAME.  CONDUCTOR THEN WALKED TO REAR OF TRAIN TO INSTALL AND ARM THE MARKER.  CONDUCTOR THEN LOCKED THE SWITCH FOR THE CONTROLLED SIDING.  HE TOLD ENGINEER THAT HE WAS HEADED TO THE HEAD END.  THE ENGINEER CONTACED THE VTR CREW THAT WAS IN THE YARD AND ASKED THEM TO PROTECT THE REAR OF HIS TRAIN SO HE COULD SHOVE BACK TO PICK UP THE CONDUCTOR AFTER SHOVING BACK, ENGINEER NOTICED THAT THE CARS WERE HEADED IN TOWARD WHITEHALL YARD. HE ASKED THE CONDUCTOR IF HE HAD LINED THE SWITCH BACK.  CONDUCTOR THEN REALIZED THAT HAD NOT AND WENT BACK TO INVESTIGATE.  WHEN HE GOT TO THE REAR OF HIS TRAIN, HE FOUND THAT THE REAR FOUR CARS OF HIS TRAIN HAD PASSED OVER THE DERAIL AMD WERE ON THE GROUND.CARS FROM REAR TO FRONT AS FOLLOWS, ACFX 51723, GMRC 551306, GATX 48735, AND GATX 48730.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

DEC01101-d-12-10-01-IC.Accident Cause: Use of switches, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
DEC01101-d-12-10-01-IC.Narrative: UP TRAIN IEPIM08, AFTER PULLING INTO BRIDGEPORT YARD FROM JOLIET SUB MAIN 2, CROSSED MAIN 1 AND MADEA REVERSE MOVEMENT, SHOVING INTO THE IMX FACILITY, STOPPING LOCOMOTIVES BETWEEN SIGNALS AUTHORIZINGMOVEMENTS IN AND OUT OF IMX. TRAIN CREW CONTACTED THE TRAIN DISPATCHER FOR AUTHORITY TO MAKE A REVERSE MOVEMENT ONTO THE JOLIET SUB MAIN 1 FOR HEAD ROOM. TRAIN DISPATCHER AUTHORIZED, BUT BEFORE MOVEMENT WAS MADE, HAD NORMALED THE MAIN TRACK SWITCH BETWEEN THE JOLIET AND FREEPORT SUBS AGAINST THE MOVEMENT. UP TRAIN PULLED FORWARD, UNKNOWINGLY RUNNING THROUGH THE SWITCH. THEY AGAIN REVERSED SHOVINGINTO THE IMX FACILITY. DURING THIS LAST REVERSE MOVE, UP DERAILED DTTX 72810, LOADED 3 PACK INTERMODAL CAR, NON-DANGEROUS ON MAIN TRACK 1 AT BRIDGEPORT, BLOCKING THE JOLIET SUB MAIN TRACK 1 AND THE FREEPORT SUB. DERAILING CAR RUPTURED A NATURAL GAS LINE TO A SWITCH HEATER WHICH RESULTED IN A FIRE THAT WAS QUICKLY EXTINGUISHED.
